discussion.content: "The DMZ is a common segment of the network for organizations to store their FTP servers"

comments.content: I agree it can be external

questions.question_text: A network analyst is providing access to an FTP server that stores files that are needed by external contractors who are working on a project. In which of the following network locations should the FTP server be placed to achieve the MOST secure environment?
A company is contracting a new third-party organization that will handle storage of the company's critical data. Which of the following policies would ensure the data remains confidential?

discussion.content:
Non Disclosure Agreements (NDAs): NDAs are the oxygen that many
companies need to thrive. Employees should understand the importance of
them to continued business operations and agree to follow them to the letter,
and spirit, of the law.

Answer A is correct. Using VLANs would allow you set up each classroom on a separate VLAN. VLANs are used to partition and isolate your network into logical groups. The purpose of this is to limit access to a group of users only. This would satisfy the requirement of each room only being able to see their own traffic. Also,this is the most cost-effective solution.
im guessing it has to do with the part of the question that says "should not be able to see traffic from other subnets." With a firewall, youd be able to see logs of traffic from other subnets.

choices.C: A VoIP endpoint connected to a hub for each network
choices.B: A router with interfaces connected to a switch in each room
choices.A: A switch with VLANs created for each segment
choices.D: A firewall with DHCP pools for each subnet

questions.question_text: A technician must install and configure a network device in a building with 20 classrooms. Each room must be on a separate subnet and should not be able to see traffic from other subnets. Which of the following is the MOST cost-effective solution?
Which of the following WAN transmission mediums is the fastest and can travel the longest distance?

discussion.content: Lmao. I sure hope to get this as a question.

Honeypot is used to capture information from unauthorized intruders. Basically, they do not allow users into their networks. They allow them into a fake network that looks like it is a part of their actual network.

Penetration testing is where you are purposely attacking to see any valnurabilites.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to purposely attack a system to exploit vulnerabilities?
